intro: Barleria salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in terminal spikes, ranging in color from pink to red. Barleria salicifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks.
